availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Indianapolis, Indiana, attorney and court clerk. Indiana native. Son of David Wallace and Esther Wallace. Married to Cordelia Butler Wallace. Father of Esther Wallace, Zerelda Wallace, Lewis Wallace, Ovid Wallace, and Annie Wallace. Attorney in Indianapolis in 1860. Employed Kate May as a servant in Indianapolis in 1860. Clerk of the Marion County Circuit Court in Indianapolis in 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Marion County, Second Ward Indianapolis, p. 143. KYR-0001-005-0007. Find A Grave, "William Wallace (1825-1891)," Memorial #39864727, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39864727 (accessed February 5, 2018).
